Primary Contact: Shelley Rattink, Aboriginal Supported Child Development Consultant; Phone: 250.768.0227 ext 108
Service Details: - Operates the Aboriginal Supported Child Development Program that serves Westbank First Nation and Aboriginal families on Reserve- Enables Aboriginal children who require extra supports to be included in child care, preschool or after school care settings when their parents/caregivers are working and/or going to school- Ensures culturally safe and sensitive service to children who are experiencing delays in the areas of development: physical (gross and fine motor skills), cognitive, communicative, social/emotional and cultural/spiritual- Family-centered program focuses on the family determining both the need for support and the goals for their child- Supports include one-to-one, centre staff education, loan of specialized equipment, and parent education/support
Eligibility: Ages: 12 year(s) and under- Westbank First Nation and on-Reserve Aboriginal families- Operates in the Westbank First Nation Child Development Centre and After School Program, the Sensisyusten Junior Kindergarten (preschool program) and community daycare/preschool programs
Address & Map: Community Services1900 Quail LaneWestbank, BC     V4T 2H3
